experience.title: Research Assistant
description: Working on detecting and eliminating security vulnerabilities in 5G wireless communication systems

experience.title: Research Assistant
experience.company: Agriculture Autonomy Institute, Mississippi State University
description: Worked on stopping mechanism for Power-Take-Off in Tractors to achieve sub-millisecond response time and improve safety for farmers
Designed mechanical and electrical systems in Fusion 360 and implemented super-capacitor based quick-stop mechanism

Procured parts, created BOM, soldered capacitors, MOSFETs, and programmed ESP32 for controls
Implemented Control Algorithm (from Ideation to Programming and Testing) to create a leader-follower based PID control system for autonomous sugarcane harvesting vehicle

projects.title: Game of Life with cross-language support
projects.description: Conway's Game of Life implementation with performance optimizations using Cython and C/C++ extensions interacting with Python via PyBind11.
projects.fullDescription: Just a Hobby project I implemented to learn Cython and PyBind11. The project implements Conway's Game of Life, a cellular automaton devised by mathematician John Conway. The simulation is visualized using the PyGame library, allowing users to see the evolution of the cell grid in real-time. The core logic of the Game of Life is implemented in C++ for performance, and exposed to Python using PyBind11. Additionally, a Cython version is provided to compare performance improvements.
features: C++ extension using PyBind11 for high performance computation
Tording algorithm for efficient state updates

projects.title: NOR Flash Memory Device Driver with RTOS
projects.tech: Embedded C, FreeRTOS, NOR Flash, STM32
projects.description: STM32 HAL based device driver for NOR Flash memories (MT25QL and AT25F4) with compatible with FreeRTOS and File System (LittleFS, SmartFS).
projects.fullDescription: A comprehensive device driver for NOR Flash memories designed to work seamlessly with FreeRTOS and popular file systems like LittleFS and SmartFS. The driver provides a high-level API for reading, writing, and managing files on NOR Flash, while ensuring efficient use of system resources and minimal latency.
